title: In photos: Hurricane Dorian
text:
Ramon Espinosa/AP A family is escorted to a safe zone after being rescued, as Hurricane Dorian continues to dump rain in Freeport, Bahamas, on Tuesday, September 3. In photos: Hurricane Dorian

Ramon Espinosa/AP A family is escorted to a safe zone after being rescued, as Hurricane Dorian continues to dump rain in Freeport, Bahamas, on Tuesday, September 3.

Hurricane Dorian has been battering the Bahamas since Sunday, obliterating houses and wiping out power.

When it made landfall on Sunday afternoon, it was a Category 5 hurricane with winds of 180 mph. It's the strongest storm to ever hit the Bahamas.

The hurricane had already lashed the Virgin Islands, toppling trees and power lines and leading authorities to declare a state of emergency.

Dorian is moving slowly toward the US mainland, and forecasts show a range of possible landfall sites. Evacuations have been ordered in parts of Florida, Georgia and South Carolina.
description: Hurricane Dorian has been battering the Bahamas since Sunday, obliterating houses and wiping out power. The storm's outer bands have started to hit Florida.
